How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:It was breakfast time.  Brad ordered eggs, toast, and something to drink. What might he drink? Choices:  A: coffee B: throw up C: food D: getting drunk E: wine<n>Output:		Breakfast time = 1<n>If it was breakfast time, Brad would order 2 eggs<n><n>Input:The game is “Name That Tune”. If that letter is chosen it has to be used in the draw stage, otherwise the game is “undrawn”.<n>Output:<n>Players: A: Michael G, B: Lisa A, C: Scott C, D: John D<n><n>Input:When it is Saturday morning, and you went to your church to get your Sunday morning sermon. A, B, D, and E are there. B is reading his Bible. C is standing in the pews. E is sitting at a table eating her breakfast. You go over to the table and say, “Have you read anything good today?” You would expect A, B, and D to be embarrassed, but they are not. “Did anyone say anything good today?’ B looks at E and says, “Well…” E looks up and says “What?” When she says that she tells everyone in the church. She then goes home and gets dressed, her sisters are at a party at another house, and her brother is out of town for work. What will you do?<n>Output: The solution is not obvious because there is no information in the answer text. The two possible solutions are B is reading his Bible, and D is eating breakfast. The only other answer is C is at a party, and E is out of town. The other answer is B is still reading his Bible, and E left town. However, since each player only had two people to choose from the answer has to be D is at the party, and the problem cannot be solved by “D still reading his Bible”.<n><n>Input: It was 11:00 and you were sitting on the bench in the park. Bob was standing on your chair. Suddenly he looked at you. What did he say?<n>Output: He stood up and said, “I wish you hadn’t changed to female, because I was only able to see your nipples”:)<n>If
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Data Information<n><n>Input: You will pick 5 words from a sentence. Choose 2 of them and give the other 4 options. Google's maps have all the roadways and have a grid on the side.<n><n>Input: A user is searching for a parking lot near a friend's house. A nearby park has parking stalls. However, when the user clicks on one of the stalls, it doesn't immediately show a place to park. How do you recommend that the user gets to the parking lot as soon as possible?<n>Output: Click the stalls with the closest entrances to the park. Once the user clicks on an entrance, they will see an "OK" icon under the stall. The user can select the "Yes" icon, select a stall, and start parking on the lot.<n>When the user does, the user will see a picture of the parking lot at the top. Once the user has clicked on an exit on a given street, they will end up back at the entrance to the parking lot.<n>If the user clicks on every exit shown on the map without a given stall in the way, they will end up on the wrong parking lot. On the sixth day after his work, he can't figure out what he put in the first box. When he arrives at school on Thursday afternoon, he finds out it was a loaf of bread. He works 8 consecutive days, and adds up his earnings per day, making $3.25 per day. His final total is $21,625 or $1,100. For example, he would earn:<n>$1.50 * ((6 * 7) / 5.5) = $1.35<n>$1.35 * ((3 * 5) / 5.5), and so on<n>The final number is $31.35<n><n>Input:<n>What color is the first line colored?<n>Output

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:James was cooling off two quickly.  He would die if he didn't find some way to stop what? Choices:  A: loss of heat B: revenge C: expansion D: relaxation E: calm down<n>Output:		  James found a way to stop what was. Choices:<n>A: He would die from what<n>B: Revenge<n>C: Expansion<n>D: Cool down<n>E: Relaxation<n><n>Output: James would die from heat. Choices:<n>1: James would die from burning<n>2: James would die from over-expansion<n>3: James would die from rapid cooling<n>4: James would die from lack of over-expansion<n>5: James would die from loss of over-expansion
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Bill is stuck in marsh when a man comes up to him peaking Cajun, where is he? Choices:  A: low lands B: new york C: forest D: louisiana E: everglades<n>Output:		 B+A-C=10B+D+E=C<n><n>Input:Bobby asked his son how many people will be spending New Year's Eve with them. Bobby and his son go to the same high school, but Bobby tells his son he needs to take school seriously. Bobby tells his son he'll leave school in a year and a half and work his way through college. Bobby asks his son how many people he thinks will be spending New Year’s Eve with them. Bobby guesses 7 people. How do you say “how many people you think will be spending New Year (a)?”<n>Output:B+A-C=7B=D+E=3D<n>A=D+E=5D-E=3E<n><n>Input:There is an underground tunnel under the ice caves between two countries. How far is it?<n>Output: 10 miles<n>So the final answer would be 10 miles<n><n>Input:A boy named Steve works in a factory that makes a type of rubber called "rubber glue." Steve makes money by selling rubber glue for $15 a box to a factory named "Dennis," an Australian. Dennis asks if Steve can sell a box of latex paint to him for 30 cents. After Steve sets up a delivery truck to deliver the latex paint to Dennis, Dennis writes a big check for $150 to Steve which turns out to be a counterfeit check. Steve is arrested and in jail for 2 months. Dennis gives Steve $180 as a gift. Dennis buys a train ticket from Steve's mother for $11.00 and sells the train ticket to Bobby. As Bobby leaves with the train ticket, it bounces, leaving Bobby in tears.<n>Output: 10-60 = 60<n>60 + 30 = 60<n>60 / 9 = 48<n>That equals (48/7) = (48/9)<n>In other words, Steve made (48/7) - 16 cents = (16/9) = 16 cents<n><n>Input:Billy and his friend Charlie were playing baseball and Charlie stepped into Billy's home, but they didn't know that they weren't supposed to. They both were sent to their parents'. Who did Billy think was home?<n>Output: Charlie was home because he heard that Billy was sent to his parents.' Billy thought Charlie was home and Charlie was home because he thought that Billy was home.<n><n>Input:Joey went to a hospital with his friend Billy and Billy was there to check himself into

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Too many people want exotic snakes.  The demand is driving what to carry them? Choices:  A: ditch B: shop C: north america D: pet shops E: outdoors<n>Output:		  too many choices of snakes make it difficult to choose.  so many people want exotic snakes that it affects the supply B. shop C. north america E. outdoor<n><n>Intro: If you are going to live in rural Utah, what must you do with all your spare time? (i.e., not working)<n>Output: Learn to drive. Be able to read and write. Go to the zoo. Learn the culture<n><n>Intro: There's only so much money to go around. A. can you borrow more money B. sell more goods C. raise the price D. increase the price of goods E. decrease the price of goods<n>Output:  all three B. sale C. raise price D. decrease price of goods E. increase production<n><n>Intro:  1) There are no good roads.   2) The school is in the same vicinity.   3) There's a gas station at the end of your street.   4) The weather is nice everyday.   5) There are no good schools.   6) There are no good teachers.   7) The schools are out of date.   8) There are no good movies.  9) There are not many good restaurants.   10) There are many good roads to drive on.<n>Intro: If your name is Richard, you're a great employee.   1)  You put in extra work at home to earn a higher salary.   2)  You don't take vacations or any breaks.   3)  You're a perfectionist.  4)  You have a high work  average.  5)  You work really hard to keep your job.   6) You don't ever lose your temper or get on someone else's nerves.  7) You stay ahead of the curve by learning new things.  8) You never call anyone out personally.  9) You don't give up.  10) You are a team player.<n>Intro:  If your name is Rick or Dave, you're not  the best employee.  1)  You get bored or frustrated easily.  2)  You are not as fast or as tough as you thought you were.  3)  You are not flexible, and you are not as good as you thought you were at anything you try.  4)  The boss doesn't appreciate your work or your efforts.  5
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:To prevent any glare during the big football game he made sure to clean the dust of his what? Choices:  A: television B: attic C: corner D: they cannot clean corner and library during football match they cannot need that E: ground<n>Output:		 Dust can be seen from the TV. This is called condensation. Dust on the corner can cause glare from the TV. This could mean your ceiling or the floor has problems that can't be corrected because they are old. It may be a good idea to consider moving it. Maybe your neighbor's place or a restaurant would be a nice place to have it.<n>Input:He wants to watch TV, how long does the TV take to adjust? * Select: 5s,10s,20s,30s,30mins,1hr,3hr etc...Output:How long will it adjust on one hour?<n>Input:Which is cheaper to buy, batteries for phone or the phone itself. Output:Batteries of Phone Batteries of Phone What is the difference between these two?<n>Input:He works in a warehouse and wants to buy new stuff like food etc., he should visit a store and check what are the prices? Which is more affordable?<n>Output:Buying new stuff at first is expensive. Buying new stuff at market is very cheap. Which is more affordable?

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:What is eating too much dinner likely to result in? Choices:  A: tiredness B: living longer C: stomach ache D: illness E: acid reflux<n>Output:		 Choices: Choices<n><n>input: On December 20, 2005, two men saw a movie in the theater. The movie was about a man trying to find out who killed JFK while wearing an Easter Bunny costume. When they left the theater, one man spotted the other wearing a Superman costume. They walked together to a nearby bank building. Since they were both armed, the robber wore a white face and Superman mask. They entered the bank, but a security guard shot the robber dead before the robber could get into the vault.<n>Input: What is the estimated length of an average dinner?<n>Output: 8.38 minutes<n><n>input: What is a common phrase that many people are likely to repeat or repeat as the last thing before going to bed? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Jame's bare feet were burned as he walked, because the sunshine had made the surface hot. Choices:  A: disneyland B: snow C: windowsill D: street E: summer<n>Output:		 He was in disneyland<n>You should find this to be true, though not to all intents and purposes. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n>Output:		 He received more calls on A, B, and C than on D. If the call volume on D is too high, he should hang up A, B, and/or C. He received more calls on C than on D.<n>He did much better on D. He had a better chance of hanging up A, B, or C than on D. He had the best chance of responding to both A and B than on D. He chose E.<n><n>Input: He had 8 minutes left. He was going to play a game for a dollar.<n>Output: He spent 2 minutes making the game. He will get one dollar for his time. He will also spend 2 minutes on his offer. In total he should have spent 8 minutes.<n>Note that the input: 8 minutes, the output: two minutes, was in the same sentence.<n><n>Input:He called his wife, who lives in Spain, on her birthday.<n>Output: He got a party invitation. He also received her birthday gift.<n><n>Input:A man wants a new set of sunglasses to wear when he walks out at night without the light on. He calls a store in his city. The woman who answers the phone says, "I am not a saleswoman," but then he asks for what reason she says that.<n>On the other handset the man says, "My wife wants me to buy some sunglasses so she can take out my driver without me seeing her driving down the street."<n>Answers:(A) You cannot buy sunglasses while the person is driving. That's too dangerous.(B) You can buy some sunglasses while your own is driving.(C) You can buy some while your partner is driving.(D) You can buy some when your wife is driving.(E) You can buy some on your travels.<n><n>Input: What is the probability that a man will do three backtoback business calls in a row on the same telephone line, regardless of the call duration, if no one else is on the line?<n>Output:The overall expected value from each of the three telephone calls would be a single sum of two numbers: 1/3 or 1/0, as shown below.  Because there is no caller waiting in the meantime, the total sum is always at least one. If, on the other hand, the caller waiting in the meantime has some effect upon the outcome of the third call, then the overall
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Where could you see an advertisement while reading news? Choices:  A: television B: bus C: email D: web page E: la ville<n>Output:		 While reading the newspaper, look at A.<n>A TV bus is something you could look for while riding a bus.<n>B is what you would see on a bus.<n>C and D are different locations in Paris.<n><n>Input:In the article, the author writes "The world should be allowed to develop faster than countries and cities, if only because that is how economic growth should happen." What does this mean? (Answers follow, except for the bolded words)<n>output: The world will not develop faster because economies will slow down as they develop because it is difficult to develop fast enough.<n>input = The world can develop faster because countries and cities can develop faster than other places.<n>Output = Economic growth through countries and cities will always decrease as they develop and should decrease.<n>output = Economic growth through the whole world will always increase as the world grows, and should increase.<n>Input = Developing fast enough is not difficult because there is economic growth in the world.<n>Output = Economic development is important.<n>input = Developing fast enough causes countries and cities to be developed faster.<n>output = Economic development is an important and always growing trend that is important.<n>input + output = Economic development, or economic growth, is happening.

He's working on a project that will require him to hire more people. He interviews 4 people for the position, 2 of them are the candidates. When he sends them the job posting, he takes the names so he knows whom he might not hire. He gives his recommendation to the person who's name he chose first. If John were offered any of the other three jobs, he would still hire them both, but he wouldn't recommend them to the candidate who's name he chose second. He's willing to give the job to one of them. Why?<n>Output: John's firm prefers two candidates he doesn't hire. He'd prefer for the one who's name he chooses first to be the candidate for the job, but he's willing to try another candidate because there's a possibility that he will make a mistake, and the candidate who's name is first isn't guaranteed the job. So in this situation one candidate may not get the job, and the other may. In fact, John thinks he'd prefer that the second candidate be hired for the job if, in fact, he knows he has a chance. So based on the information John got in the job posting, he would hire both of them and recommend them to the candidate he chose first in the first place. So the final answer is his firm prefers two candidates he won't hire. And he'll recommend them to the candidate with his first choice.<n><n>Input:A is interested in the color red when wearing shoes. How can you tell if A likes red? (In other words, how can you tell from an experiment whether A likes red? (The answer involves wearing red shoes.))<n>Output:A doesn't like red, so she decides she won't wear red shoes anytime soon. But she wants to wear them.<n>Input: A has 4 siblings. 3 are boys and 1 is a girl. She doesn't have any friends because she is shy and she doesn't really talk to anyone she doesn't know very well. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:The fat man refused to accept what was possible, he complained that he what the simplest activities? Choices:  A: no go B: unlikely C: unable D: cant do E: impossibility<n>Output:		 The Fat Man wanted to take one trip to Mars, but for his flight, he bought a ticket to another country. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:At the end of your meal what will a waiter do? Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n>Output:		 Set table<n>Dishwasher = serve<n>Server = present<n>Bar / Table Servite = prepare<n><n>Input: At the end of a meal, what will a waiter do that doesn't involve the customer? Choices: A: remove salt B: tip C: wash dishes D: pour coffee E: serve drinks<n>Output: Set table * tip / service time x table / time<n>Dishwasher = prepare<n>Server = serve<n>Bar / Table Servte = prepare<n><n>Input/Output:<n><n>Input: 2x = 4x + 2x + 2x + 1X + 3X + 1X<n>Output: 4+ 2 + 1 = 2<n>Binary: x + 2 = 2 + 1<n>Integer: 1 + 2 = 2<n>Scalar: 1 + 1 + 2 = 2 (x + 1)<n>Multicode: [x + 2] + [2 + 1] * x<n>Multicode: 2 + 2 = 2<n>Coded: [1 + 2] * [2 + 1] = 2<n>Coded 2 = 1<n>Coded 1 = 1<n>Coded 0 = 0<n><n>Input: If C++ is C then what is EigenDB?<n>Output: EigenDB<n><n>Input: A,B,C are all integers<n>Output: B,C<n><n>Input: Two people have a child by means of a female and a male. If A and B both have 1 children how many children does A and B have?<n>Output: A,B,A,B,B,A<n>If you want them the answer is 0<n><n>Input: 1,2,3,5 are all integers and so is 1,2,3 and 5<n>Output: 1,2,5<n><n>Input: If you wanted to know the answer to this question, what questions do you think you would ask and when do you think you would find an answer to them?<n>Input: Which of the following statement applies to P,T?<n>Output: All six<n><n>input: A is number 1 and B is number 2<n>Output: A,2,1,2,1,7,1<n><n>Input/Output:(i,j) means input and output respectively, i.e. the input and the output of the algorithm, if i is a floating point number 1 and j is a boolean number 1 then this should be output/input according to i and j meaning i,j<n>1
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:You can hear testimony of how spirituality changes lives when you do what? Choices:  A: go to church B: appear in court C: watch soap operas D: paying attention E: go into court<n>Output:		You can hear testimonies of how spirituality changes lives before you do these things.<n>Subtracting 2 for each weekday, we get:<n>Monday = 2 / 5 = 10 hours<n>Tuesday = 2 / 5 = 15 hours<n>Wednesday = 2 / 5 = 21 hours<n>Thursday = 2 / 5 = 25 hours<n>Friday = 2 / 5 = 30 hours<n>Since Wednesday is one full week off and Friday is one full day off, we get:<n>Saturday = 3 / 5 = 45 hours<n>Sunday = 3 / 5 = 61 hours<n>Monday = 3 / 5 = 64 hours.<n>Tuesday = 5 / 5 = 70 hours.<n>Wednesday = 5 / 5 = 75 hours.<n>Thursday = 5 / 5 = 80 hours.<n>Friday = 5 / 5 = 85 hours<n>Since only 2 work days are weekdays, we get:<n>Sunday = 3 / 1 = 45 hours.<n>Monday = 3 / 1 = 48 hours.<n>Tuesday = 3 / 1 = 56 hours.<n>Wednesday = 3 / 1 = 59 hours.<n>Thursday = 3 / 1 = 65 hours.<n>Friday = 3 / 1 = 67 hours<n>So we get:<n>Tuesday = 60 hours.<n>Wednesday = 60 hours.<n>Thursday = 60 hours.<n>Friday = 60 hours.<n>Saturday = 70 hours.<n>Sunday = 70 hours..<n>Then we get:<n>Saturday evening = 77 hours<n>Sunday evening = 75 hours<n>24 hours x 77 = 2 hours<n>24 x 75 = 1 hour<n>30 hours x 2 = 4 hours.<n>4 hours = 8.5 hours<n>25 hours x 4 = 14.5 hours<n>14.5 hours x 14 = 24 hours.<n>24 hours x 24=60 hours<n>6 hours = 16.5 hours.<n>16.5 hours x 24=72 hours<n>72 hours x 24=240 hours.<n>24 hours' x 48=60 hours.<n>You will have spent 120 hours trying to follow the gospel of Jesus Christ.<n>What happens to us when we do what Christ has commanded us to do?<n>So the final answer depends on:<n>1. Your ability to do what Christ asks us to do.<n>2. The amount of time you invest learning the scriptures<n>3. Your willingness to commit to his plan.<n>Therefore<n>4. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:I'm looking for alcohol and fried foods, any suggestions? Choices:  A: pub B: plane C: beer D: store E: fraternity house<n>Output:		  Let m = the total beverage volume in a litre bottle. At 5 millilitres, let v = 1 litre in a litre. For 5 litre bottles, give a unit: ml. Now multiply v by 4 to give: m / 0.125 = v / 0.625 = 10 litres. Divide by 2 to get: 0.125 litres.<n>Let v = 10 litre of beer. At 0.125 ml per litre, 1 litre in a bottle = 5 ml. Therefore the total volume of beer in a bottle is 20 ml. With v being one litre, 20 ml in a bottle = 20 ml / 2 = 16 ml in a litre. At 0 ml / 2, 1 mL / 2 = 16 ml / 2.<n>Therefore the total bottle volume of beer in a litre is 16 ml.<n>Since beer = 1 ml / 2, 16 mL / 2 = 4 mL in a litre.<n>Since beer = 2 ml / 2, 20 mL / 2 = 4.2 mL in a litre, 16 ml / 2 / 2 = 16.22 mL in a litre<n>That means that the total volume of beer = 60 ml in a litre<n>The final answer is 60 ml in a litere<n><n>Input:I have 2 pieces of information: a phone and a book. I want to know how many phone calls have been made on it during the year?<n>Output: M is the number of calls made on the phone, N is the number of books read.<n><n>Input:C is the number of days until the next football game. D:C is the number that will end up before that game on Sunday. D:C is a prime number.<n>Output: P is the maximum number of days. N is the number of dates. A is the square root of P.<n><n>Input:What is the largest number of students entering an undergraduate program at once?<n>Output: If n=100, then the maximum number of students is n/(100+100+100+100), where n is the number of current students.<n>If n is too large, then the program is not full<n>If both n and n>100, then the program is actually full, and needs to be expanded<n><n>Input:Cantor wants to know the number of days until he graduates. Can he find the answer by finding the number of days since he was 7?<n>Output: C is the number of
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree.  Three fall off.  Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n>Output:		 The answer is "C"<n><n>Input: "One million dollars is equal to one hundred fifty thousand dollars. How many dollars is equal to one million?"  What is this an answer for? Choices:  1: 1000 * 10 = 1 million 2: 10 * 10 = 1 million 3: 10 * 60 = 1 million 4: 10 * 24 = 1 million 5: 30 * 30 = 1 million 6: 30 * 30 = 100<n>Output: The answer will be "A"<n><n>Input: Two men on each side of a river. They have only 1 hour to find a boat and navigate to an island. In their search, how many minutes does each man get?  Output: "60 minutes on each side of the river.  2 hours at the equator.  1 hour at the poles.  2 hours at a distance.  3 hours at the equator."<n>Output: 3 hours.  The equator is 4.30 miles from north to south and 12.66 miles from east to west.  That equator has a circumference of 12 miles.  If you look at a map of earth's circumference, "North" is east of the equator, and "South" is west of the equator.  Each of the above options is an answer for "C".  In order to answer the question correct, you have to know the names (EVERY ONE) of the poles, and where they are.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:What might a kid do with his friend before going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: being entertained D: math E: meet<n>Output:		 A: laughter, sitting, being entertained, math, and being entertained<n><n>Input: In the middle of September, a 12-year-old boy named Adam asked his parents if he could go camping with a friend in a nearby campground. His mom said yes because she thought it would be a nice break. However, Adam asked if he could stay the night with a friend from high school the same night. He told his mom that he would take a friend of his, but he would not be able to go camping with him, because the friend's father is a minister. How is this situation different from any other similar situation?<n>Input: Adam has been camping before, but this time he is bringing his friend.<n>Output: One, Adam's mom had an obligation to a church program, so she cancelled. Two: Adam is bringing a friend that would be camping with him, so he decided not to bring his parent along. Three: Adam is bringing a 12-year- old boy from high school.<n>The two things that are different with this situation are:<n>1: Adam knows that his dad is a minister.<n>2: Adam is bringing a boy from high school, who knows that his father is a minister, but does not know that his father is planning on camping with him.<n>So both Adam and his friend are camping with each other.<n>Output: This is one of those situations where things are different than they appear, so answer it.<n><n>Input: At the very top of the Earth a man lives off the grid while he has just 3 employees. No one comes into his house or does any work in his house. He has about 15 kids. He is in a long-term relationship with a woman who works full time. He lives in a camper which is the style of van that people use for RV travel. He lives alone. He is a bit addicted to drugs. He lives the same way that every other adult in the world lives. Which one of the statements is the truth?<n>Output: None of the above<n><n>Input:If there is an Olympic athlete (male or female) on the top of a mountain next to it an employee comes to get a soda and sees that the athlete has a girlfriend. The employee immediately thinks, "Wow, this guy is just a selfish selfish guy to live life that way." The employee takes a picture of the athlete and post it on his Facebook wall, "Looks like I need a girlfriend." Which statement does not come
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. Her total hours worked each day was 30 hours. How many hours worked each day would Tina have if she worked more hours each day?<n>Input: 24 divided by 4 = 30<n>Output: 30 * 3 / 4 = >3<n>Therefore, Tina averaged 2.5 hours extra work per day.<n>So the final figure is >3<n><n>Input:Mary worked 6 hours a day at home everyday for two years. Mary's total hours worked per week were 60 hours. How many extra hours would Mary work if she worked an extra 2 hours each day?<n>output: 60 + 4 = >12<n>Therefore, an extra 2 hours a day added to the total worked by Mary amounted to a 12 day workweeks and a total overtime time of >12 days total<n>So the final figure was >12<n><n>Input:Mary works 16 hours every day at home. Mary is tempted to throw it away.<n>output: 9 x $5 = >15<n>Therefore, Mary's gross hours spent at home every day amounted to 16 hours. A E  F S<n><n>Input:Joe took a three year break from work while he was home on holiday. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:If you did well on the test, you might get an A as a what? Choices:  A: see work B: practice C: quiz D: school grade E: homework<n>Output:		 If your best guess is A, the correct answer is school grade A<n><n>Input:There are four women attending a small group of women. At 5 a.m., they enter the pool room through the large, double door. All are naked save for sun dress or swim cap. Two of the four are clothed but one wears a robe. How many women share one bathroom, one shower, and one toilet?<n>Output: 3 women share one bathroom, 3 share one shower, and 1 share the toilet<n><n>Input: A baby rabbit is placed on the back of a chair. A human holding a bat takes its place at the front. The bunny runs around, kicking the bat and making funny sounds. How long will the baby rabbit go around?<n>Output: 20 minutes
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:What is a good result of jogging? Choices:  A: insect repellent B: heart attacks C: improved health D: shin splints E: being tired<n>Output:		 There was a 50% decrease in how many hours Lawrence worked each day.<n>A) 3.5 C) 6 B) 9 E) 9<n><n>Input: What are the two rules which rule out using water in a dishpan?<n>Output: The above answer is not true<n>Input: A is the same answer as B<n>Output: B is not the same as A<n> input A: A B) C<n>Output: C<n>input A: B<n>Output: C<n>Input: A is B<n>Output: C, D<n><n>Input: What is a good way to cut your coffee cost? Choose the best option from the choices below.<n>Input: A: $3 is better than B: $4 or $5 is better than C: 1st cup is cheaper than 2nd cup D: the best option is 2nd cup and 1st cup<n>Output: 1st cup is cheap, 2nd cup doesn't make you feel bad<n>1st cup: cheaper than 2nd cup<n>2nd cup would be the best answer if you have enough money<n>2nd cup: the answer is D<n>1st coffee cup: 3rd cup would be the best cup if you didn't feel bad<n><n>Input: Which of the following is the simplest to use for the above question?<n>Output: B<n>Output: A<n><n>Input: How big is the biggest star in the sky during a full moon?<n>Output: 10 degrees<n>Input: A star. 10 degrees<n>Output: D, E<n>input input: C<n>output C<n>output C<n>input: D<n>output<n><n>Input: What can we say about the fact that the man in the middle of the screen has a nice smile, and he doesn't look like he's going to explode?<n>Output: he's the leader<n>output:<n>1st person is second person, 2nd person is first person, 3rd person isn't first person<n>if the other answers are also first person :D<n><n>Input: What does the number 3 stand for?<n>Output: Three and a Half<n>Input: C and E<n>Output: B and E<n>input: D<n>input: C

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Bob's feet hurt from running barefoot on the hot pavement.  I lost his shoes, didn't know where they landed, and had to run from the corner store to his home.  About where did he run? Choices:  A: a bed of nails B: town C: attractive consistent look D: city block E: ground<n>Output:		 >75% >75% >75%.<n>So after looking at each picture Bob came up with a solution:  He ran a few feet north of this point, around the street to the sidewalk and then ran back home.<n>The final answer is 5<n>The final answer was 5, which is the best answer because 5 is the right answer and Bob came up with the final choice which is the best answer.

I don't like guys." The student that is asked to make up a boy or a girl will probably say "Oh! Yes, he (boy) likes me!" or "Yes, he (boy) never did anything wrong to me." ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Traveling underwater has many dangers, such as low visibility causing what? Choices:  A: disorientation B: due to C: meeting new people D: getting somewhere E: relocation<n>Output:		 Choices: A: disorientation, C: meeting new people, E: relocation<n>1. D D E D E 1. A E D E D E 1<n><n>Input: A student is at the restaurant and his companion asks what would the waitress say if she heard a girl in the back who was singing 'Dancing Queen'?<n>Response: 'I don't know what that is, but it sounds like you are trying to sing.' and he would keep walking.<n><n>Input: A female classmate asks the other male classmate, "When do we start dating?"<n>Response: "Today?" and he would leave her alone<n><n>Input: A boy and student are both on the football team. Which side have the player on now?<n>Response: "The offense!"<n><n>Output: Choice A<n><n>Input: You are given three tickets to a basketball game involving the Washington Wizards and the Oklahoma City Thunder. Who is the more valuable player?<n><n>Response: The first<n><n>Input: Four students are all told they will be tested at the beginning of their 3rd year of high school, but where is the test being held?<n>Response: in the school playground<n><n>Output: In each group that chooses first place, the scores are:<n><n>First place:<n><n>Second place:<n><n>Third place:<n><n>4. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Dying E: Dying<n><n>If we think of "death" as an inevitable part of life, then it seems as though we would not think of it as something which can be avoided. However, "death" is in fact, possible, and so would it be possible also if we wanted to avoid it? Let us think of a "death ray". A "death ray" is a ray with a big, yellow bulb at the top, which can only be hit by a very large object. If we want to avoid the death ray, we must run away from it. To avoid "death", we must move to some place where we are not in any danger of being hit by the death ray when it is aimed at us. We would also have to run away from other objects which have been hit by the death ray while we are in the new place. Choices: A and B: Run Away and Run Away, respectively. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Output: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>So the final answer is 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Output: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Output: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>So the final answer is 5<n><n>Input:Glass that hasn't been treated to be extra strong is what? Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n>Output:		 glass that isn't weak, fragile, weak, fragile, weak or forcefully flimsy.<n>A: weak<n>B: fragile<n>C: forceless<n>D: regular<n>E: flimsy<n><n>Input:You must choose 10-15 answers from the following list and arrange them in any order.<n>Output: In order of answers.<n>1. Water that is not exposed to air for 12 hours is what?<n>2. It takes 3 million years to become super dense so water will never become super dense.<n>3. Water that has a particle diameter of 1/10 millimeter is which?<n>4. When someone puts their hand inside a fridge, how will it cool?<n>5. In order of answer:<n>(dots, dashes, lines etc.)<n>6. A person who is allergic to one ingredient has all the ingredients of: what flavor/flavor additive<n>7. In order of answer (only 1 selection needed):<n>(flavor, flavor and ingredient)<n>8. A person who lives within 1 km of a water table has more than twice the water of everyone else living within that same km. How much water is in every person of that area?<n>9. In order of answer.<n>(people living within km and 1)<n>10. Who has the lowest weight gain from the beginning to the end in a year?<n><n>Input:Soda: a) 4 calories, zero carbohydrates, b) 0 calories, zero carbohydrates, c) 1 or more calories, d) 2 or more calories (zero carbohydrates), e) 0 calories<n>Output:Caffeine, zero carbohydrates, 0 calories, 2 calories to sugar, and (carbon dioxide)<n>(carbs have a zero carb count, carbs do not have the 0 carb count, carb does not have the zero carb count)<n>1. soda b) zero calories<n>2. soda c) carbs (sugar)<n>3. soda e) calories (diet coke)<n>4. soda f) calories (coke)<n>5. soda g) calories (pop)<n>6. soda h) calories ( sprite)<n>How many calories is 1 or more?<n>How many calories is zero grams of carbon dioxide?<n>2. soda b) 5 or less<n>3. soda c) no excess calories<n>4. soda e) 0 energy<n>5. soda g ) no energy<n>6. soda h ) no excess energy<n>7. soda (soda)<n>
